confirmed_facts: Fire broke out at 2:50â€¯pm local time on 26â€¯Novâ€¯2025 in a highâ€‘rise apartment block in Tai Po, HongÂ Kong.
At least 13 people died, including one firefighter, and about 10 people were injured.
Seven of the eight blocks in the 2,000â€‘unit complex were engulfed by the blaze.
Bamboo scaffolding used for maintenance work was a factor in the fireâ€™s rapid spread.
Firefighters rated the incident as a 5â€‘level (maximum) fire and are still conducting rescue and extinguishment operations.
No Korean nationals were reported among the casualties.

timeline.event: Fire started at 2:50â€¯pm in Taiâ€¯Po highâ€‘rise apartment block.
Fire spread to seven of eight blocks; casualties confirmed.
Firefighters rated the incident as 5â€‘level and began rescue operations.
